Sometimes the Eclipse IDE file search fails to find words in files that are really there. Others I work with have seen this too.

I've just been able to reproduce this several times with different words and different files. In these cases, only if I first opened and closed the file that contains the search term would Eclipse be able to find the term in that file.

The files being searched are on a Samba mount but I don't know if that has anything to do with it.
Search works well usually, so can you provide a test case showing the trouble you get with it? Are you using Java Search or Search only? What do you mean by "Samba mount"?
Please provide steps to recreate, then reopen.

I'm using the Search/File... dialog, with the *.java file name pattern. Case sensitive is turned off. Scope is set to Workspace. The source files are in a "linked to" folder. When I have time, I'll try to recreate this in a new project. I can't share my current project, which is still experiencing this problem.

To answer your question about a Samba mount, Samba is the name of some software that allows part of a UNIX file system to appear as though it's a Windows XP drive. But I don't know if this has anything to do with the problem.

I think I've fixed the problem for now by selecting the project and then choosing the File/Refresh menu option. I'm not certain how the project got into this state, but I believe I've experienced this problem with other projects. Other people that I work with have complained of the same problem in their projects too. I think it's at least a bug to not prominently alert the user in the UI that the search is skipping files due to a perceived resource synchronization issue.

(In reply to comment #6)

After much searching I found that files get into a 'out of sync' state when they are modified outside of Eclipse. The biggest source of this is a version control update on a source tree. I have found that Eclipse doesn't always refresh a workspace when starting up and thus files will remain in a state of 'out of sync'. There should either be an indication of this in the search or simply an auto refresh of existing resources that are being searched.

Did you see the option 'Automatically refresh' in Preferences > General > Workbench?
If you have that already enabled, please file bugs against platform.core.

There was a bug that the information dialog after search didn't show up that would tell you that there are resources out of sync.
This is fixed now (3.4) and I just verified you get the dialog.
See also comment 9.
